title: Ticket #1315: RFE: Provide a maximum cluster id value, useful in controlled envs
description:
In some controlled environments it is desirable to specify a maximum value for ClusterIds.

The Schedd already allows for controlling CLUSTER_INITIAL_VALUE and CLUSTER_INCREMENT_VALUE. This is a request to provide a CLUSTER_MAX_VALUE to round out the feature set.

  1. This knob certainly makes sense from a logical completeness point of view, but I am curious about a real-world example that would need it... I ask mainly because I've used the other knobs (cluster start and increment) numerous times, but I've never thought about the need for a max id value....

  2. Looks like these commits should have been squashed together before pushing. Please checkout GitPushChecklist, esp the part right at the beginning about git squashing together if "any of the commits is a partial implementation" or "two or more of the commits could be considered to be a logical group". Thanks!
